packagegui.title: Status: Sarg User Settings

field.description: Select the sort field for the User Report.

Users within the file will be excluded from reports.
Format: One user per line.

Reports will be generated only for listed users.
Format: user1:user2:...:userN

You can change the "userid" or the "IP address" to be a real user name on the reports.
If 'Convert IP address to DNS name' is active, the IP address is resolved before being looked up into this file.
That is, if you want to map the IP address, be sure to set resolv_ip to no or the resolved name will be looked into the file instead of the IP address.
Note that it can be used to resolve any IP address known to the dns and then map the unresolved IP addresses to a name found in the usertab file.
Table syntax: 'userid name' or 'IP_address name'

Examples:
SirIsaac Isaac Newton
vinci Leonardo da Vinci
192.168.10.1 Karol Wojtyla

Enable LDAP search for username replacement based on Active Directory information.
This option is useful to show full usernames in Sarg reports instead of user logins.
FQDN or IP address of host with LDAP service or AD DC.

DN of the LDAP user who is authorized to the search the LDAP database.
Example: CN=username,OU=group,DC=mydomain,DC=com
Input the password for 'LDAP Bind User DN' specified above.

Specify the LDAP search base DN. The search base is the place in the hierarchical LDAP structure where the search for user accounts starts.
Example: OU=users,DC=mydomain,DC=com

Use this to filter the user login entries to be returned for a search operation in LDAP. First found record will be used.
%s - will be changed to user logins from access.log file filter. Search filter string can have up to 5 '%s' tags.
Default value: '(uid=%s)'

Name of the attribute containing the login name of the user
Default value is 'cn'. For Active Directory, use 'sAMAccountName'.
